intro: Chaetanthera elegans var. pulchra, commonly known as the beautiful chaetanthera, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are finely divided and have a fern-like appearance, while its stems are hairy and often branched. This variety is valued for its ornamental qualities and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate beauty.
